author: sky.cactus
content: https://discord.gg/8Fnbg3FU9h is a great place to get started, that is where all of the MEV advocates hang out.

author: andrius.a
content: Hi, can anyone give some pointers or show some good articles about ethereum traceability problem, I tried to google but so far it's only more questions

author: sky.cactus
content: Do you mean the lake of transaction privacy?

author: andrius.a
content: I will write about traceability and protection so I just look for info

author: andrius.a
content: ways to trace and ways to protects from tracing and so on

author: sky.cactus
content: What do you mean by "tracing"?  Do you mean identifying where ETH came from when looking at a particular account?

author: andrius.a
content: yeah, like location of origins and how much money comes and gets out

author: andrius.a
content: You know, in some cases if You buy something You contact bank to give You e- money and after that it's confirmations and so on. So I guess I will read about wallet step in eth anyway but I might need more ideas.

author: sky.cactus
content: Ethereum simply doesn't offer any transaction privacy.  That is pretty much the whole story.  ðŸ™‚

author: andrius.a
content: ok, thanks, I will think about what prof. had in mind by saying 'You should write about traceability in Ethereum' ðŸ˜„

author: sky.cactus
content: Maybe they were suggesting you look into tools to break traceability on Ethereum like Tornado.cash?

author: andrius.a
content: I asume this is what he had in mind

author: andrius.a
content: But I still will have to talk more with him and check. He also said, I can cover entire protection protocol with this topic so I guess it's not a big trouble.

author: sky.cactus
content: Ethereum is fully traceable (other than Tornado.cash).  It is sometimes a bit challenging to trace, but significantly easier to trace than Bitcoin.
